thinking: My task is to find and navigate to a crate. I don't see any crates in my current view. I see some barrels in the center and slightly on the left-hand side, and a doorway on the right-hand side. To search for a crate, I will turn left to scan the area.

I am searching for a crate. I now see several crates stacked under an archway on the left-hand side of my view. To bring these crates towards the center of my view so I can approach them, I will turn left.
The crates are now mostly centered in my view, located under the archway ahead. My task is to navigate to the crate. Since the crates are in front of me, I will move forward to get closer.
I have moved closer to the crates under the archway, which are still in front of me. I need to get nearer to complete the task, so I will continue moving forward.

I am getting quite close to the crates, which are directly in front of me. One crate is prominent in the center-left portion of my view. I need to get right next to them, so I will move forward again.

I am now standing very close to the crates. The nearest crate is on the left-hand side of my view. There are more crates behind it and further left. To better face the group of crates under the archway, I will turn left.
After turning left, the cluster of crates is now centered directly in front of me. I have successfully reached the crates as instructed. The task is complete, so I will finish.
